Joining the list is not mandatory. The List is meant to facilitate contact between everyone working to promote Ubuntu at all levels, leaving your name and email address means that you have read and understand the <nowiki>[[marketing-guidelines|Code of Conduct]]</nowiki> and that you are open to anyone working on the goal of promoting Ubuntu.

Let us know you are there by joining the list. <<BR>>
If you want to see a coordinated marketing campaign <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/marketing/list?action=edit&editor=text|JOIN THE LIST]]</nowiki>. <<BR>>
If you want to take part of Ubuntu Marketing <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/marketing/list?action=edit&editor=text|JOIN THE LIST]]</nowiki>. <<BR>>
If you want to tell everyone about your site or what you do <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/marketing/list?action=edit&editor=text|JOIN THE LIST]]</nowiki>

If you have questions or ideas it's better to contact the related <nowiki>[[marketing-Teams|team]]</nowiki> before contacting anybody directly.

==== Admins of Ubuntu websites and social networks ====

Admins of related (FLOSS, Linux etc) websites are also welcomed and encouraged to join the list. 

If you have problems with the formatting leave your info and somebody will set it up later or else contact any of the mails below to get help.

==== LoCo Teams ====

If you own a LoCo team and want to contact people nearby, Ubuntu Facebook and Website admins can help you send a message to people from your country. It's also recommended to create a facebook group or social space to facilitate contact with local Ubuntu fans.
